::Fenox::

Fenox turns to look at Vlad when she hears his speak, looking him 
over. She smiles back. Fenox hadn't seen this bot before in the base, 
so he must be new.

"Of course," she replies in a friendly tone, turning away from D and 
facing Vlad. "What do you want to know?"



--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Carnage Blood" <Carnage@d...> wrote:
> ** Vlad hadn't really had any chance at the battle at the Alliance 
base but he hadn't really been into action to begin with, more as in 
leaning towards using his brain then his weapons. He was, indeed, far 
from weak but he didn't see running blindly into trouble as a good 
policy on keeping one's life. He put his rifle away and looked down 
at Shesta, who had stayed near him the whole time.
> They were simply wasting time here and Vlad was eager to locate Von 
so that they could end this and their mother's land would be his.
> At that thought Vlad smiles to himself and ran a hand over Shesta's 
silky head, knowing that he always got what he wanted. However, he 
didn't want to risk injury to himself and would need a hitman who 
could get rid of Von for him, if he was still alive. Mother had 
always said that Von wasn't anything to be scared about, that his 
spark was bigger then his brain. Which, for Vlad, would make his fall 
all the easier.
> So Vlad turned towards the IronFist, Shesta on his heels, and began 
to move towards it. A pair of bots catching his interest, a fembot 
and some wolf. Walking towards them as they seemed to enter the base, 
Vlad flashed one of his famous smiles.** " My Dear Lady, may I ask 
you a simple question which'll only take a cycle of your time?" ** 
Vlad approached Fenox, Shesta still at his heels. He wanted to know 
if she could recommend somebot he could use as his hitman, which was 
why he was here in the first place.
> Vlad had always known how to impress the ladies, and his young and 
handsome looks only helped him the more. not to mention, he was 
always taller then most of them, and in this case it was no 
exception. But all he wanted was to know, not to court.**
> 
>
